intro.title: What does the Bible say about God?
intro.description: Many people do not believe in God because they have a distorted vision about who He is. They think about God as a tyrant or arbitrary being. But the Bible is clear to reveal that God is love (1 John 4:16). His character is love, so everything that He does is rooted in love.

16 For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life.

questions.description: Every good father knows that losing a son is the most painful sacrifice that could ever happen. To believe, therefore, that the God of the Bible offered His son in sacrifice to save human beings from perishing (John 3:16) completely redefines who God is and His love for us. There is no greater proof of love than that.

questions.description: In addition to being presented as a God of love, the Bible also declares God’s righteousness (Psalms 7:11). He is the only One who can balance these two traits perfectly: righteousness and goodness. Therefore, we realize that the image of a tyrant and arbitrary God does not match all these virtuous traits.
questions.questionTitle: 1 John 4:16 says that God is love. Besides this attribute, what other trait of God’s character can be found in the Bible?
